channel.title: Applications on Marcos M. Raimundo
channel.description: Recent content in Applications on Marcos M. Raimundo

item.title: Identification of Taxonomy of Ants
item.description: This research project studies the identification of taxonomic genus of ant specimens with a picture of its head, dorsum, and profile (three views). We employed Convolutional Neural Networks to identify each view and used ensembles to aggregate the learning of the multiple views, improving the robustness of the predictor.

item.title: Detection of Epileptic Seizures
item.description: This research project studies multiple feature extractions in EEG recordings of various patients with epilepsy. The first approach of this project employed a multiobjective transfer learning approach to promoting joint learning among the patients and an ensemble method to aggregate the multiple feature extractions. A second approach explored a multiobjective approach that weights the influence of each feature extraction.
